heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 28 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.7°C) and outside temperature (down 2.4°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 744 m) and light levels (up 6100 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 6531 lux) and cloud levels (up 706 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 744.4m lower than yesterday, 673.8m lower than the past week, 705.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 789m and a high of 3200m, averaging 1032.6m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and bright intervals likely. Similar weather conditions should remain.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (91%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
